Detailed Description

Holds the implementation of the synchronization sub-system.

Definition in file sync.c.

Function Documentation

int allocate_port ( const unsigned long  id,
const int  new_owner 
)

Allocates and initializes one port from the port table.

Returns:
an index into the port_table if a port could be allocated or -1 if no ports are available.
Parameters:
id  Identity number of the port after allocation.
new_owner  Id of the process becoming the new owner of the port after allocation.

00027 {
00028  register int i;
00029  register int first_available=-1;
00030 
00031  /* Loop over all ports to see if the port has already been allocated. */
00032  for(i=0; i<MAX_NUMBER_OF_PORTS; i++)
00033  {
00034   /* We keep track of the first available port. This way we do not
00035      have to scan the table twice. */
00036   if ((-1 == port_table[i].owner) &&
00037       (-1 == first_available))
00038   {
00039    first_available=i;
00040   }
00041 
00042   /* Check if the port entry match the one we want to create. */
00043   if ((new_owner == port_table[i].owner) &&
00044       (id == port_table[i].id))
00045   {
00046    return -1;
00047   }
00048  }
00049 
00050  if (-1 != first_available)
00051  {
00052   /* Set the new owner and new identity. */
00053   port_table[first_available].owner=new_owner;
00054   port_table[first_available].id=id;
00055 
00056   /* Initially, the sender queue is  empty and there are no receiving thread. */
00057   port_table[first_available].receiver=-1;
00058   thread_queue_init(&port_table[first_available].sender_queue);
00059 
00060   return first_available;
00061  }
00062 
00063  /* Return -1 if we ran out of ports. */
00064  return -1;
00065 }

int find_port ( const unsigned long  id,
const int  owner 
)

Find a port with identity if owned by process owner.

Returns:
the index into port_table of the port if a matching port is found. Returns -1 otherwise.
Parameters:
id  Identity number of the port that we want to find.
owner  Id of the owning process of the port that we want to find.
